snippet: By Thanksgiving, it was clear that Kathleen Sebelius, the departing Health and Human Services secretary, would eventually have to go.
abstract: Kathleen Sebelius's path to resignation as secretary of Health and Human Services became clear as far back as Thanksgiving, as White House was overwhelmed by fallout from health care website debacle; Obama administration lost confidence in Sebelius as problems with website mounted, attacks from Republicans increased and Democrats facing reelection called for a change in management.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR, JACKIE CALMES and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: By Thanksgiving, it was clear that Kathleen Sebelius, the departing Health and Human Services secretary, would eventually have to go.

headline.main: Sebelius’s Slow-Motion Resignation From the Cabinet
headline.print_headline: A Slow-Motion Resignation From the Cabinet

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
